title: South Live: Friday 29 September - BBC News
summary: plans to ban begging and sleeping rough in poole .
stuck dolphin had to be put down .

documents.title: good evening
text: that 's it for bbc south live for today .
the service will resume at 08:00 on monday when we will be bringing you the latest news , travel , weather and sport from across berkshire , dorset , hampshire , the isle of wight and oxfordshire .
you can get in touch anytime with your and news on our hampshire , dorset , berkshire and oxford facebook pages or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid

documents.title: building fire overnight in wallingford
text: firefighters fought a blaze in a converted barn in oakley wood near to wallingford overnight .
six fire engines were at the scene as crews fought a `` fully developed building fire that was rapidly spreading towards neighbouring properties '' .
station manager paul webster said : `` on arrival we were faced with a challenging incident , we needed to protect the neighbour 's property and fight a fire within a converted barn .

`` the owner of the building soon arrived on scene and were able to give the crews good information about the contents and layout of the building , this helped us to understand what we were facing and where to focus our initial firefighting actions . ''
the cause of the fire is being investigated .

documents.title: publisher defends 'dubious ' children 's book
text: a publisher has defended a children 's book after a background scene was described as `` dubious '' on twitter .
two pages in pond dipping - part of the long-running biff , chip and kipper series - appear to show three men talking in the bushes , followed by an old woman 's shocked reaction .
but oxford university press ( oup ) said the pages had been taken out of context and were `` age appropriate '' .
other pages from the series containing adult content were also shared online .
one shows building blocks spelling out the word `` hepatitis '' next to a group of children , which oup said was changed in 2003 .
in a message liked 12,000 times , ed brody posted the suggestive pages and said : `` somewhat dubious scenes spotted in the background of a friend 's 4yo 's school book . ''
a spokeswoman for the publisher said : `` we would like to reassure you that our books are created with the utmost thought and consideration .
`` we take the utmost care to ensure that our content is age appropriate and would not cause harm or offense to any child who reads our books . ''
somewhat dubious scenes spotted in the background of a friend 's 4yo 's school book
going viral again ed ?
such a twitter celeb .
no child should see her
i do n't get it
lol it 's a bit weird
probably lol
do n't wander down to the river when asked to keep look out , that old woman 's shock could have been avoided ?
kids do n't really notice it , adults will get a chuckle from it .
since adults often have to narrate or guide these books , it 's fun .
it is n't fun .
it 's fuckin weird though .
trying to put this stuff in children 's minds at a young age is disgusting
if you want to see ghosts , you will see ghosts .
hey @ twitterid this seems like your kind of thread

ok , i 'm guessing this book predates the expression we know and love today !
still a weird title .

documents.title: latin dance festival hits bournemouth
text: hundreds of dancers from across europe will taking part in the onedance latin festival this weekend .
it starts today at the bournemouth o2 arena and will include salsa and zumba dancing .
the event will also include the final of the uk bachata stars competition with the winners qualifying for a place in next year 's world bachata stars final .

documents.title: woman dragged along floor in bungled bus stop robbery
text: a woman was dragged along the floor during a robbery attempt at a southampton bus stop .
a man grabbed her bag while she was near central library on commercial road , between watts ( west ) park and the seacity museum , about 22:00 last friday .
he pulled at her strap , pulling her to the floor in the process .
she held on and was dragged along before he let go and fled towards havelock road
she suffered grazes to the right hand side of her body .
det con kirsten davey said : `` it has been reported to us that the man responsible left the area in the direction of the bbc building . ''
the man is described as white , slim , about 6ft , wearing a dark hoodie , blue jeans and light trainers .

documents.title: oxford college removes suu kyi portrait
text: oxford college removes suu kyi portrait

documents.title: seven cars stolen in garage break-in
text: burglars have stolen seven cars and damaged other vehicles in a break-in at a vehicle workshop in dorset .
police were called at 07:24 bst to a report of an overnight raid at westover car group in leyland road , poole .
detectives gave no details of the vehicles taken or vandalised .
westover said it was still assessing the extent of the damage to the workshop , which services its renault , fiat , peugeot , hyundai and dacia showrooms on wallisdown road .

documents.title: farm homes decision delayed until november
text: a controversial planning application for hundreds of homes on the edge of bridport will be decided in november , a month later than expected .
developer hallam land management wants to build 760 homes , a care home , a school and other facilities at vearse farm on the edge of the town .
west dorset district council said the decision , originally due on 12 october , had been delayed to agree legal terms .

documents.title: red funnel steps in to sponsor evening service
text: red funnel is sponsoring an evening service on a trial basis across the medina river on the isle of wight .
the £ 3.2m cowes floating bridge was taken out of service earlier in august after suffering numerous failures .
kevin george , ceo of red funnel said : `` the river crossing is vitally important to both local residents and red funnel 's customers .
`` we are therefore pleased to offer financial support for the service and we would encourage as many people as possible to make use of it . ''
councillor stewart , leader of the iw council said : these are difficult times for all those involved and we are very grateful for this gesture of support for the community by red funnel . ''

documents.title: roy of the rovers to be rebooted
text: out-of-print british football comic roy of the rovers is to be rebooted .
the adventures of roy race , a star striker known for his amazing football skills and sense of fair play , first saw print in the 1950s .
the character 's weekly comic ended in 1995 , and he featured in match of the day magazine until its cancellation in 2001 .
he has not been seen since .
oxford-based rebellion will publish a series of graphic novels and books alongside the 2018/19 football season .

documents.title: botley road gas repairs complete
text: it 's hoped temporary traffic lights on botley road in oxford will be removed this afternoon after a gas main was repaired .
the work has been completed and the repair team is now waiting for the road surface to set properly , said southern gas networks .
earlier three-way traffic lights at the junction with ferry hinksey road caused long delays during the morning rush hour .

documents.title: man injured in the new forest after being bitten and attacked by `` gang '' of pigs
text: a rambler has spoken of his shock after being attacked by a group of pigs at a new forest beauty spot .
author: Bournemouth Daily Echo

documents.title: cctv image released after racial assault
text: an image of a man wanted in connection with a racially aggravated assault in southampton earlier this month has been released .
a 22-year-old man suffered injuries to his face during the attack outside maxim , a fast food shop , on southampton high street .
it happened between 01:00 and 01:20 on wednesday 13 september .

documents.title: shortlist for new southampton flag
text: residents are being asked to choose a new flag for southampton .
six possible designs have been selected from over 500 entered by children aged between 5 and 16-years-old .
the chosen flag will be added to the flag institute 's uk flag registry and become a recognisable symbol of the area , southampton city council said .

documents.title: 46 units at £ 240m shopping centre still not open
text: more than a quarter of the units at a £ 240m shopping centre in bracknell are not yet open , three weeks after its launch .
the lexicon centre website shows 46 of the 169 units at the one million sq ft ( 93,000 sq m ) are vacant or not year open .
a third of bracknell town centre , built as part of a new town development in 1949 , was demolished as part of the creation of the lexicon .

documents.title: six snakes abandoned outside havant pet shop
text: the rspca was called to rescue six snakes who were abandoned outside a pets at home in havant , hampshire , on saturday .
a man arrived in the morning and found the reptiles left in storage containers .
rspca inspector adam standen said : the snakes had been left alongside a note from someone called dave who was pleading for help to rehome them as he could no longer cope with them .
`` sadly , this is n't unusual .

we are finding that many people are unaware of how much of a commitment these animals are when they take them on , which we believe may be why we are rescuing hundreds of reptiles every year - and this number appears to be on the increase . ''

the snakes - four corn snakes , one common boa constrictor and one carpet python - are being cared for by an exotics specialist in bournemouth and are all doing well although they are being treated for mites .

documents.title: women charged for impersonating medic
text: a women has been charged for falsely claiming to be a medical professional and administering an injection to `` a patient '' at an equestrian competition .
cassandra grant , 38 , of mulberry walk in bristol , is accused of intravenously injecting an anti-sickness drug at the blenheim horse trials earlier this month .
she was arrested by thames valley police yesterday .
ms grant is due to appear at banbury magistrates court later charged with fraud by false representation and assault occasioning actual bodily harm .

documents.title: coral reef opens after £ 13m redevelopment
text: coral reef opens after £ 13m redevelopment

documents.title: rnli ends summer patrols in dorset
text: patrols on beaches at bournemouth , poole and weymouth finish this weekend as the summer season ends .
they will stop at 18:00 bst on sunday 1 october on 13 beaches in dorset .
the rnli says once the lifeguard season ends people visiting beaches can keep themselves safe by taking note of safety signage and being aware of conditions .

documents.title: new roadworks cause delays in oxford
text: roadworks caused long delays for drivers heading into oxford from the west this morning .
temporary traffic lights botley road at the junction with ferry hinksey road resulted in delays of up to an hour on roads in the area
the oxford bus company says its buses were caught in the delays and the a420 and a34 was also affected .
taken 55 mins to get from cumnor to farmoor on a420 .
still stuck .
why ca n't there be a p & r lane further back ? !
@ twitterid @ twitterid
botley road : this is heavily congested due to temporary traffic lights and also some gas works .
sorry for any inconvenience caused .

documents.title: stranded dolphin put down
text: a dolphin which became stuck in a hampshire river has had to be put down .
a kayaker spotted the animal struggling in shallow water in fareham yesterday afternoon .
fire crews , animal specialists and divers from the british marine life rescue team tried to help the animal but efforts to save it failed .
@ twitterid @ twitterid the moment a stranded baby dolphin is pulled from fareham creek # news # fareham # hampshire # dolphin # rescue
drove past earlier and saw something going on .
definitely did not expect it to be a dolphin rescue !
hope its ok !
sadly the poor thing was euthanised at the scene
that 's sad , would be great to have had a good outcome .

documents.title: plan to ban begging in poole
text: an order banning begging and sleeping in car parks or doorways is being considered for poole .
the town 's council is consulting on whether to implement it in three areas covering much of the borough .
people sleeping in shop doorways or church porches would be moved on or face a £ 100 fine , under the order .
religious leaders have described the plans as draconian but poole 's council says `` no one should need to sleep rough in poole '' as its housing options service can provide help .

documents.title: plan for statue of morse creator
text: plans for a statue to remember colin dexter , who created of the inspector morse novels , have been announced .
the inspector morse society wants to place the monument in oxford , the author 's hometown and the setting for the novels .
preliminary designs for a full size mr dexter holding a semi-complete times crossword have been drawn up , the society said .
it estimates it will cost £ 50,000 and has launched a fundraising campaign .

documents.title: water park reopens after £ 13m upgrade
text: an indoor waterpark in berkshire is reopening to the public after undergoing a £ 13m refurbishment .
coral reef waterworld in bracknell closed in january last year for the major upgrade that includes five `` customisable '' flumes .
the park now has five interactive waterslides - the cannon , poseidon 's peril , maelstrom , storm chaser and aqua splash - where the user can choose from a range of light and sound experiences .

documents.title: hello
text: good morning and welcome to south live on friday 28 september ( it 's nearly the weekend , hooray ! )
we 'll be bringing you the latest updates from across berkshire , dorset , hampshire , the isle of wight and oxfordshire until 18.00 .
you can get in touch with your and news on our hampshire , dorset , berkshire and oxford facebook pages or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
